meanings.definition: To become accustomed to a new climate or environment.
meanings.sent1: After a few days in the mountains, she acclimatized to the thin air and steep trails.
meanings.sent2: The tropical plants acclimatized quickly to the greenhouse conditions.
meanings.sent3: The penguin acclimatized to the warm weather by shedding its winter coat.
meanings.sent4: Like a chameleon, he acclimatized to any social setting effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: She acclimatized to the bustling city life by embracing the constant noise and movement.

meanings.definition: To adjust or adapt to a new situation or surroundings.
meanings.sent1: The new student acclimatized to the school routine within a week.
meanings.sent2: He acclimatized to the fast-paced work environment by organizing his tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The robot acclimatized to its programming flawlessly, completing tasks with precision.
meanings.sent4: She acclimatized to the chaos of the kitchen during the dinner rush.
meanings.sent5: The athlete acclimatized to the pressure of the competition, performing at his best when it mattered most.
